data.text: Bikepacking with an Ebike

Anyone else Bikepacking with an ebike? This is my wife‚Äôs ready for an overnighter. We get about 80km on this - and plan routes so we stay in farmstays to recharge. Awesome (I load her up with the heavy stuff üòÇ)
I‚Äôd make her lug all the heavy equipment.

data.text: what are those forks? is that some funky suspension?
data.author: Josh Levine

data.text: yeah Lauf Forks - been around for a long time - good for gravel riding- take out the chatter and much lighter than suspension fork.
data.author: Andy Jones

data.text: sweet!
data.author: Josh Levine

data.text: Is this a special saddle for women?
data.author: Lars Lars

data.text: not women specific but it is a wider saddle and has a large cutout - so benefits yes - check out Selle SMP - this is the Pro model
data.author: Andy Jones

data.text: Awesome, but she has a lauf? Cruel!üòÇ
data.author: Jeff Schoeny

data.text: why cruel
data.author: Andy Jones

data.text: just joking! I have one on my fat bike. I love it on gravel and mellow stuff. They get weird on singletrack. That bike looks so capable! Not having something else to maintain is the best part. There is nothing that can wrong on the laud
data.author: Jeff Schoeny

data.text: yeah for their intended purpose they are great - but yes not a replacement for a tru suspension fork for mtb duties üëç
data.author: Andy Jones
Ben Meyer

data.text: I don't hate it.
data.author: Jeff Emrich

data.text: Our friends just did a 7,000 mile bikepacking trip on Dost e-bikes. Dual batteries. Made in Canada. is their FB page.
data.author: Bobbie Gullickson

data.text: * assembled I suspect. China owns 98% of the market.
data.author: Trek Mike

data.text: yes they are assembled in Taiwan.
data.author: Bobbie Gullickson

data.text: Yes. So glad to see someone else doing it.
data.author: Jerry W. Cole

data.text: I've been hopping trains and ferries all over Northern Europe and the Baltic countries for last couple weeks. Huge amount of e-bikes set up for touring mixed in with the regular bikes.
data.author: J.c. Mcguirk

data.text: yeah if you can plan the route to stay in towns etc it‚Äôs easy - for back country stuff I think I need a dual battery setup. Really like tent camping in the bush
data.author: Andy Jones

data.text: when I hiked the Appalachian Trail a couple years ago there were several solar charging station setup for small personal electronics. A network of larger ones for be ebike batteries maybe in the future ü§î
data.author: J.c. Mcguirk

data.text: Can‚Äôt say it‚Äôs a bad idea, if you have the e figured out.
data.author: Neil Doran

data.text: Nice!!!!!
data.author: Barb Petrie

data.text: My wife and I were just talking about this today! How long can y'all normally go in between charges? We will be buying a backup battery but we weren't sure it would get us far enough without having to sleep in hotels every night to recharge.
data.author: Weston Beavers

data.text: yeah this was our worry - normal 500Wh battery will get you about 60-80km depending on terrain and how well you use your gears to conserve battery - so we will be getting an extender battery - but we generally like to stay bush in tents or farmstays where they let you recharge - I would recommend an extender battery to give you around 120 km range. If you are touring where you can stay in hotels or caravan parks it‚Äôs much easier as you can recharge there - so generally 70km is a safe distance
data.author: Andy Jones

data.text: Awesome, thanks for the advice!
data.author: Weston Beavers

data.text: so many factors go into "how long the battery lasts". I have a Trek hardtail, bosch cx performance motor with 500w battery. On eco (easy on paved/gravel), I get 25 miles before my battery display "drops 1 bar" (out of 5).
data.author: Brandi Jackson Hodges

data.text: That‚Äôs a moped.
data.author: Shawn Zenor

data.text: Yep, saves my dodgy knees!

data.text: I do regular camping, bike packing trips on my ebikes ,Taking a spare battery and charger, off road do 50 miles a day on road up to a hundred, Small towing trailer on road, panniers off road, Done the KWA fully self sufficient over 4 day on the gravel bike camping. Great fun
